org.araneaframework.framework
Interface SynchronizedRequestRegistry

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
StandardHttpSessionRouterService
public interface SynchronizedRequestRegistry
extends Serializable

A contract interface for components that take care of propagating actions synchronously and asynchronously (in the context of underlying service, not in the context of user sessions, which are always synchronized). Since most actions are propagated asynchronously (because it does not block other users requests to the underlying service), the contract is about registering actions for synchronized actions (that affect all users).

Note that the underlying implementation does not have to guess when to stop propagating registered actions in synchronized manner. It stops doing that once unregisterSynchronizedAction(String, String) is called for that action.

By the way, Aranea users should not use this interface directly to enable synchronized actions. An action is registered automatically as synchronized when it implements SynchronizedActionListener.

Since:
2.0
Author:
Martti Tamm (martti@araneaframework.org)

Method Summary
 boolean isSynchronized(String actionId, String targetPath)
          Provides whether the action with given actionId and targetPath is processed in synchronized manner in the context of underlying service.

Method Detail

registerSynchronizedAction

void registerSynchronizedAction(String parentScope,
                                String actionId)
Registers an action with given parent component scope and with given action ID. All action request to the given scope and action listener will be handled in synchronized manner (all other incoming requests will be processed once the the action listener completes).

Parameters:
parentScope - The scope of the component that has the action listener.
actionId - The simple action ID.
Since:
2.0

unregisterSynchronizedAction

void unregisterSynchronizedAction(String parentScope,
                                  String actionId)
Unregisters an action with given parent component scope and with given action ID. All action request to the given scope and action listener will be handled asynchronously after calling this method.

Note that, by default, all action listeners are processed asynchronously (in the context of the underlying service, not in the context of user sessions, which are always processed synchronously), so calling this method for an action listener that was not already registered with registerSynchronizedAction(String, String), does not change anything.

Parameters:
parentScope - The scope of the component that has the action listener.
actionId - The simple action ID.
Since:
2.0

isSynchronized

boolean isSynchronized(String actionId,
                       String targetPath)
Provides whether the action with given actionId and targetPath is processed in synchronized manner in the context of underlying service.

Parameters:
actionId - The ID of the action.
targetPath - The scope of the component that contains the action listener.
Returns:
A boolean indicating whether the matching action listener is synchronized.
Since:
2.0
